meanings.definition: To loosen or remove a screw by turning it counterclockwise.
meanings.sent1: I need to unscrew the lid from the jar to open it.
meanings.sent2: He used a screwdriver to unscrew the bolts from the metal plate.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unscrew a screw with a spoon is like trying to eat soup with a fork.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a gentle hand helping me unscrew the tight lid of my emotions.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick where he seemed to unscrew his head and then reattach it.

meanings.definition: To remove or disassemble by turning or twisting in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent1: She had to unscrew the pieces of the broken toy to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic carefully unscrewed the engine parts to replace the faulty component.
meanings.sent3: As the robot tried to unscrew its own head, it realized it had no hands.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to unscrew the alibi the suspect had carefully put together.
meanings.sent5: The idea of forgiveness can unscrew the bitterness that has been tightly wound around your heart.
